MS: Find the syntax error in signal assignment

The signal assignment below appears in the VHDL description of a
    circuit. The assignment is flagged as having a syntax error. Which of the
    following could be wrong with the signal assignment? Select all that could be
    wrong. Recall that a syntax error is a violation of the rules of a language,
    not a logical bug.

    sig_a <= 0;
column3: NOT HTML

MS: RightAnswers

column3: sig_a has type std_logic_vector, which doesn't match the type of the literal 0
sig_a has already been assigned a driver  somewhere else
sig_a was never defined as a port or a signal.
sig_a is an invalid identifier
sig_a has type std_logic, which doesn't match the type of the literal 0
